headline: Buffalo Chicken Wings I
description: Deep-fried chicken wings are simmered in butter and hot sauce to pack quite a kick.

video.description: See how to make restaurant-style Buffalo chicken wings.
video.name: Buffalo Chicken Wings I

name: Buffalo Chicken Wings I
recipeIngredient: 1 quart vegetable oil for deep frying
24 chicken wings, tips removed and wings cut in half at joint

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a large skillet or deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Deep fry chicken wings in oil until done, about 10 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet or deep fryer and drain on paper towels.

Melt the butter in a large skillet. Stir in the, vinegar and hot pepper sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add cooked chicken to sauce and stir over low heat to coat. The longer the wings simmer in the sauce, the hotter they will be. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: It was easy pret work and cooking. Also fast to do on a budget.

I made the sauce exactly as shown and it was delicious. My method for wings is a little different. I deep fried them first whole after salt, pepper and a soak in buttermilk. (It's good to dry them off a little before putting them in the hot Crisco otherwise it spatters everywhere.) After frying, I painted this sauce on them and let them stay in a 200-ish degree oven until we were ready to eat. My husband and my friends raved over them!
These wings were easy to make and delicious!
I followed the recipe as written. It was way too vinegary and way too thin. The vinegar was overpowering.

This recipe was great! Cooked my wings longer because my husband likes it super crispy. Franks red hot wings sauce with a little melted butter in a pan over medium high heat. poured over the wings! Delicious!
I've had this recipe in my collection for years and it's still a family favorite!
Very good; crowd pleaser because we all love some wings with a kick.

This is by far the best recipe I have found for wings. My family and friends can't get enough! I only made one change - I did not simmer wings in sauce after they were fried - toss the wings in the sauce. If you let them simmer, they become soggy. Who likes soggy wings! Without the simmering in the sauce, these wings have great flavor and are nice and crispy! I will be making these for the big game today! GO PATS!
Very much like the real Buffalo wings found in restaurants throughout the upstate NY area. Crispy and delicious! Serve with chunky blue cheese dressing and celery sticks, of course!
This buffalo wings recipe was great!! The sauce was spot on for a spicy, flavorable wing sauce. I would suggest the frying time to be more like 15 minutes for a crispier wing.
Best buffalo chicken, taste yummy??

I've been making these for years both at home and in restaurants. This is a great recipe as close to original as you can get. Here are a couple things that I change in mine. First never use butter always margin. Butter will separate into heavy fats and light. and you can always add more hot sauce go easy at first and preferred is Franks red hot. Know your hot sauce! 3rd drain your wings out of the fryer on cookie sheet lined with parchment and cake cooling rack ( think reheating). Season to personal tastes I add a pinch of granulated garlic and a dash or two of Worcestershire.
I made these just as the recipe called for and there wasn't a wing left, for they were all ate. The heat was just right for me but my husband added more hot sauce to his. I will keep this recipe.
Turned out great! I put them in the oven after the skillet with the sauce to crisp them up a bit!

Born and raised in Buffalo but moved away. This cured the craving, but we like them very very crispy so I cook them at 400 degrees for a few minutes longer. Also didnt use vinegar in the sauce, and tossed the wings and sauce in a bowl so they didn't get soggy.
AMAZING
OMGoodness! I will never eat wings out again! Followed recipe to the “T” and they are delicious. My hubby loves them.. Thank you so much!

I'm from Buffalo NY ... we don't simmer the wings in the sauce, we put the sauce in a huge stainless steal mixing bowl and we toss the wings until coated. You HAVE to use Franks Hot Sauce ... that's how we do it in Bflo ... NO OTHER SUBSTITUTE ...
My favorite wing recipe!
Awesomeness!

I loveeeeee this recipe! I have a deep fryer and followed the recipe just as it says, but I did cook them for 15mins instead of 10 and I didn't add any salt. I also made some sweet potato fries to accompany them. I love how easy this recipe is and it's so quick to prepare. Especially when you have hungry kids lol
Pretty decent recipe though I might have made it a tad salty and over deepfried. Kinda dry but hey everyone finished the wings. Will adjust next time
This sauce is excellent though I prefer more sauce and spicier. I simmered for 30 minutes. Next time I will double the sauce and either simmer for 45 or possibly add more Texas Pete's.

Made these last night for my husbands birthday and they came out so good. The recipe is so simple to follow and such few ingredients but such a great result. My husbands only criticism was they they weren't spicy enough, I used Franks Red Hot sauce for wings but next time I will try the regular Franks hot sauce.

Very easy to make. A couple of quick notes. Dust very lightly with corn starch, then fry as directed. Add the melted butter and hot sauce (and honey if using) into a large bowl. When wings are done, dump them into the bowl and shake to coat. Add salt and pepper and you’ll have the best wings you ever tasted. The corn starch gives a nice crispness to the wings.
These were amazing! Weren't too spicy for me, which was great. Had to cook about 3 minutes longer then recommended, but otherwise these were perfect and tasty!

Super good and super easy. I deep fried my wings from frozen for 15 mins at 375. Kept the batches warm in a 200 degree oven, then tossed them in the sauce, to which I added a touch of honey, because I love me some sweet n hot wings!
Made these for dinner last night, I was a rock star with the family. I'll be making these a lot. Thanks for sharing such a wonderful recipe.

This recipe is fantastic. I've made it several times. The only changes I've made are adding a dash of Tabasco and a tablespoon of flour to the sauce. The flour thickens the sauce nicely and makes it take on this exciting red/orange color. I've also experimented with different herbs and spices. I use Frank's Red Hot for the main hot sauce.
plain,simple and very delic...

Great Sauce, not enough for 24 wings so next time, I will make a little more. It tasted very well when I seasoned chicken and baked them for 15-20min and then coated them with sauce, then baked them for another 15-20min. Wish I had another batch of sauce to make them even more spicy but was still very yummy !
Bloody lovely made it we all enjoyed it
I made a few changes in this recipe but the family love it!

These were quite possibly the best buffalo wings I ever had. I can hardly believe I myself made them. And it was so quick and easy too. Only difference I made in the recipe is I brined the chicken wings in salt and pepper water for an hour and then I cooked following the directions. These were so good my son and I are probably going to finish all 24 pieces today. Easiest recipe in the world. Now to find a good blue cheese dip recipe.
Great wings, love the recipe as written. We had these with blue cheese dressing and celery sticks, and they were fantastic. Spicy and perfect.

i baked wings @ 400 degrees for 60 minutes. and pretty much followed recipe. put in double vinagar, a bit of honey, and tablespoon whistershire. I didn't think there would be enough sauce but there was plenty to mix with wings. stirred wings around in sauce for about 3-4 minutes and they wuz perfection. gonna keep the recipe.

i baked wings @ 400 degrees for 60 minutes. and pretty much followed recipe. put in double vinagar, a bit of honey, and tablespoon whistershire. I didn't think there would be enough sauce but there was plenty to mix with wings. stirred wings around in sauce for about 3-4 minutes and they wuz perfection. gonna keep the recipe.
Less ingredients but bursting with flavor!
These are great! Really simple to make and a bit hit with family and friends.
Very good! I added flour to the sauce for thickness, and baked the chicken.

Truly took only 25 minutes and just in time for football. 
A very light sift of flour gave a crisp crunch!

Buffalo wing perfection! I don't live near a pizza place that can make good buffalo wings, so I am happy to have this sauce recipe. I didn't bake the wings, I floured the wings and fried them. I did have to double the sauce because of the flouring. So delicious.

This recipe is missing garlic and a few pinches of cayenne pepper. Its a good jumping off recipe to add things to it to make it your own. If nothing else, add garlic and you'll have a much better tasting wing.
I used this recipe this evening and the hubby and son loved them!! I simmered the wings for about 15 minutes and they where perfect!!!
I used frank's redhot for the sauce and threw some garlic in it to give it a little bit more flavor and my wife and daughter loved them
Me and my son loved these wings.Applebee has nothing on this recipe.Thanks for sharing.
Got over my fear of frying and these wings were FANTASTIC! Really tasty and perfect for the Atkin's diet!
Very good!!!

I just tried this. I didnt put a lot of hot sauce since i dont want it too hot.. My husband said and these are his words. This is perfect. He finished the plate and rated this 5 stars. Followed all directions except not too much hot sauce.m
Delicious!

These are awesome! My husband is a huge wing fan and he is still raving about these! I made 2 minor adjustments. ...I baked them instead of frying and I added some cornstarch to the sauce to thicken it abit so it would stick to the wings more. My husband said he these are the best wings ever!

Husband absolutely loved. I'm more of a 4ish, but then again I'm not a buffalo wing nut like he is (grin). For mine, I added a splash of honey, a dribble of Worcestershire, and then a squirt of ketchup ... As far as the rest of the procedure went (for my records, sorry) went ahead and baked earlier in the morning, then when it came time to eat, tossed in sauce and ran under the broiler. Came out nice and juicy and not dry at all (big fear). Thanks so much for recipe! Oh - I did only simmer for about 5 to 8 minutes as I was worried about the spiciness. Next time go to 15 minutes or so........

I am not a wing fan but I made these for my husband. He claims they are the best he's ever had. I must confess, they looked and smelled so good, I had to try them too. Delicious (and just so you know, I usually say ICK)! This recipe is a keeper, and I will make wings this way from now on till forever!

I baked the wings til crispy, made the sauce exactly as written, brushed it on the wings, baked about 8 minutes more to set the sauce. Oh my it was good!!! I don't fry wings cause of the snap,crackle, and pop...lol

Fantastic! I baked mine on a rack over a cookie sheet on 425 for 40 minutes, then turned it up to 450 for the remaining 5-10 minutes. They crisped up nicely. I put all the wings in a large bowl and poured the sauce over to coat. Much cheaper than take-out and just as good, if not better! Thanks for the recipe!

I love the sauce for these wings. I usually fix 24 wings so I double the sauce and add 2 cloves of garlic to let the wings simmer in. The only other thing that I do different is I BBQ the wings first on a grill and then I simmer them in the sauce for about one half hour. LOVE EM!
Good sauce for buffalo wings, I did thicken it up with a little flour
Being from Buffalo NY, this is pretty much it. Use Franks Red Hot if ya can, and fry in peanut oil if you have it. Always dip in blue cheese, never ranch!
Perfect, easy to make hot wings. They were a huge hit!!

Perfect recipe for perfect wings. Now on game days i get out my deep fryer and make wings. I only purchase party wings from the stores so I dont have to do the extra step of cutting the wings before frying.
My husband said it was good but not as hot as expected. Still a good recipe.

I followed the directions exactly for the sauce and it was wonderful - the only thing I did differently was add some chopped jalapeno to the sauce while it was simmering to give it more of a kick since we like really spicy food. Instead of using the sauce on wings I baked some chicken breasts and coated them with the sauce - very good.

I tweaked this between this and the Buffalo Chicken Wings III one. After deep frying the wings I added the following sauce: Melt Butter and add finely chopped garlic and a couple of pickled capsicums (finely chopped). Fry for a while until fused in the butter. Add some ketchup and Bajan Hot pepper Sauce – I used Aunt Mays Bajan Pepper Sauce – let it bubble and add the wings and turn to low heat … Came out kinda with a sticky spicy kick… Did not take a picture – sorry.

This is the recipe I have been looking for! These ae great wings! I wish I had bought more than 3 Lb. of wings when I made these! The vinegar was definatly a plus! Gave it that extra kick and smell! This will now be my standard wing recipe!

Simple to make and even better than restaurant wings! I would suggest baking them, as it is much more simple and healthy than frying. Simmering the wings will give them back the juicy wing texture you are used to! I simmered mine for about 45 minutes to make them extra spicy.
These are the best with fresh celery and homemade ranch sauce. I ONLY use Franks Red Rot "Hot Buffalo" wing sauce. A deep fryer is a must to ensure correct temperature. Enjoy!

This recipe is Awesome. I also like Buffalo Ranch & Garlic wings that I had at a little sandwich shop, the people were from NY, they knew how to make the best wings. They closed down so I came here looking for a recipe & this was the best one, So I made this one & added 1 tsp. of Garlic Powder and 5 tbsp. of Ranch Dressing, "Remove from heat before adding the dressing", then toss over the wings. I like mine crispy, so I don't simmer the wings in the sauce. I took these wings to a friends house for a football game, Everyone was bringing wings, and mine were the best, they were gone first, Everyone loved them.
Always a hit at my house!
I did the simple way and fried the chicken, made the sauce, gave them both the ole' shake and baked them for about 20 minutes. if you simmer them, you won't get that crunch that everyone likes

This was really good but I used 
Tapatio sauce. Easy to make aswell.

I used frozen chicken nuggets rather than wings, since that's the only chicken I had on hand when I got a craving for buffalo chicken. I baked them until they were crispy and then followed the recipe for the sauce. They were delicious! My kids and husband loved them too!
Super easy to make at home and yields the same results as most restaurants. Thanks for sharing.

I promised my kids Buffalo Chicken Wings for dinner but the restaurant where we normally order from was closed. I looked online and tried this recipe. To my delight, my family prefers this recipe to any other wings they could try. It was excellent!
These were so good! I made the mistake of adding salt to the first batch, which these definitely did not need. The 2nd batch was amazing though. Will be making again.
Excellent recipe! Just skipped the simmering part because we like our wings crispy.

I baked mine for an hour at 375 degrees. I give this 4 stars because it WAS NOT enough sauce for what is listed. I made literally double than the amount listed for 24 wings. (My friends and I love our wings a bit saucy.) Everyone loved the sauce....LOVED! I made some on the side for the non meat eaters for their soy nuggets. It was seriously a hit! :) DELICIOUS!

This recipe is also not hot. It actually tastes like "medium" from Pizza Hut. :) I used the Frank's Hot Sauce. (Not the "wing sauce" because the recipe becomes altered when using the "wing sauce." 

It was great though! :) Will use again!

These were awesome! However, they are VERY VERY VERY SPICY!!!!!!!!!! I can't stress enough that if you don't eat spicy foods (like me) very often these will hurt your tongue and lips after eating them. Start with 1 (ONE) tbsp of hot sauce first. Then add more if desired.
So good! Next time I will make more of the sauce though, it just barely covered the 16 wings that I made.
Even better if you use Red Wine Vinegar in the saucse. Also, sprinkle parmesean cheese on the wings 10 minutes prior to leaving the oven.
Really good just added some spices to wings before frying quick easy and were great for super bowl
awesome recipe. made them for the superbowl party and they were a hit. they have some heat to them but not too much. i used franks hot sauce but i would have rather used franks Extra hot sauce.
I MADE THESE TODAY FOR THE SUPER BOWL. FROM NOW ON I WILL ONLY USE THIS RECIPE!! IT IS AWSOME!! SO QUICK...SO SIMPLE...YET THE BEST WINGS I HAVE EVER MADE!!THANK YOU FOR POSTING THIS RECIPE.
THIS is the way to do wings, no flour no crazy seasonings. straightforward good wings.

I have used this recipe at Super Bowl time for years and the wings always disappear like magic! I have learned how to tweak it a little for those who prefer milder wings. I shake the wings in a bag of seasoned flour (I use Hooter's) first, then add 1/4 c honey to the sauce. I make two batches so everyone can have the heat level they want.
I've worked in Restaurants my whole life, and of all the recipes I've seen here, this is the closest one to the ones we made, at every restaurant I ever worked at.
These were a big hit and I'm making them again for a Superbowl party. Wings took 9 minutes to cook in FryDaddy and we added 10 drops of Tabasco to the buffalo wing sauce. A must try!
Easy and delicious. I like my wings hot, so I added extra hot sauce.
Like other viewers I also bake my wings as opposed to frying ( I hate splattering oil!) I use Cholula hot sauce mix in fresh garlic and butter and toss in the baked wings.. So delicious!

We love these wings! They're our new favorite - even better than what we get at most restaurants! A couple of tips that helped us: the longer you simmer the sauce the spicier it gets. So if you like hotter wings, let the sauce simmer for 30 minutes or longer. Second, my husband likes his buffalo wings crispy, not soggy. To achieve that, he fries the wings separately in a deep fryer, then sets them aside in a bowl. Once the sauce has finished simmering, he pours the sauce over the wings in the bowl and mixes the wings around to coat evenly. It produces crispy and tasty wings every time.

This recipe is great. I did make a couple of changes. First I melted butter in sauce pan and once melted added two tablespoons of flour and cooked for about 2-3 minutes. Secondly, I added a dash (1/2 teaspoon) of worschestershire sauce. Also, I used Franks hot pepper sauce (5 tablespoons) not to be confused with hot sauce. I added approx 4 tablespoons of Louisana hot sauce. Put sauce in a bowl when wings were hot of the grease, added them to the bowl and shook them. They were DELICIOUS! *dont overcook sauce as it will seize up, even if it does...can still be used as long as the wings are piping hot)

If you want to reduce the amount of fat and have equally tasty wings, steam the wings for ten minutes, refridgerate for one hour, and then bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Then turn the wings over and bake for 20 minutes more. There is no need to simmer the wings in the sauce. If you want them to be hotter, just adjust the sauce to butter ratio. These wings, steamed and baked, are even crispier than the fried version and very good! Also, there is little need to add extra vinegar. The hot sauce is almost all vinergar anyway. It is better if the extra is omitted.

I didnt have the right ingredients so i had to use chopped up a hicken breast mixed milk and an egg, put the chicken in and we put in a bowl of flour mixed with garlic salt, salt, and pepper. Tastes great, and would definitly would reccomend this.
love theses and hot wings r my abstulote favorite thanks hannah
This turned out great. I'm going to try grilling the wings instead of frying next time.

These wings are amazing. We do everything as is written except we add Tabasco sauce to the vinegar and hot pepper sauce. For the hot pepper sauce we use Frank's Red Hot Wings Buffalo sauce. We do let them simmer for about 10 mins. We like our wings with some zing. Dip these in ranch dressing and enjoy with a frosty beer.

These were incredible. I've never loved wings, but after this recipe...I'm beginning to see the light! I made these for father's day and they were perfect! The texture and the flavor were out of this world! I liberally salted the wings before I added them to the oil and didn't need any in the sauce. We're very mild-type people, so I took the suggestion to use Louisiana hot sauce and I only simmered it for about 5 minutes. Unfortunately, I'm not sure how much hot sauce I actually got into the pan as I just kind of nervously eyeballed it. It worked though and was the perfect blend of enough heat to give it a kick but not enough to overpower the flavor. It was perfection! Thanks for a great recipe. It's my new favorite! PS -- This would be an awesome recipe for a low carb diet!
These were very easy to make and the flavor was good. I do like mine a little hotter than this recipe, so I added more hot sauce and red pepper flakes to bring the heat.

These were GREAT!!! I actually used Frank's RedHot Buffalo Wing Sauce, added a few splashes of the Franks RedHot Original Sauce, about 1 tsp. of crushed red pepper, and about 1 Tbsp. of butter. Talk about FIRE!!!! My husband and son often talk about wings not being hot enough. These wings had their lips throbbing!!! (I got them both.) They were a bit too hot for my liking, but I didn't let them see me sweating inside. lol

I just love this recipe.....simple and so delicious!!!! My Husband LOVES it...... we shared the first batch and he told me later that he really wanted to swat my hand because he wanted it all.......I am making them again right now (Just for him) Thanks!!!!
